revised_title: Weak Interaction Studies in Strange Particle Leptonic Decays
tldr: The article discusses experimental results on strange particle leptonic decays and compares them with predictions based on the rules of weak interactions and electron-muon universality. The data support little to no violation of the rules and are in good agreement with the Cabibbo theory. The branching ratios for various hyperon leptonic decays and the observed form for decay are explained by the theory, though the data is not precise enough for a definitive test.
